creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
Nomen est omen should not be the case here :)

The problem is caused by percentage font sizes in the default publication's page
CSS. They are aggregated when the corresponding HTML elements are located inside
each other.

So it's actually not a TinyMCE integration bug.

creator: nettings@apache.org
text:
yeah, this one bit me, too. but i did not bother to fix it, since as you say
it's not a tiny issue really and my custom publications are not affected. there
is a quick workaround:
add appropriate styling to src/modules/tinymce/resources/css/editor_content.css.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text: This will improve when the default publication CSS will be refactored.
